definition: to divide/to separate/to distribute/to allocate/to distinguish (good and bad)/part or subdivision/fraction/one tenth (of certain units)/unit of length equivalent to 0.33 cm/minute (unit of time)/minute (angular measurement unit)/a point (in sports or games)/0.01 yuan (unit of money)

sentences.english: In Beijing, most branches serve four sittings in one day.

sentences.english: We will oppose the setting up of any Walmart stores in the W /Cape.

sentences.english: Take the voucher to your local branch of Woolworths and it will be redeemed for one toy.

sentences.english: Which branch do you usually go?

sentences.english: However, she added, the branch is now using distilled water.
sentences.chinese: 她還補充說道，現在這家分店使用的是蒸餾水。

sentences.english: I was lured to the Enfield store by the Krispy Kreme website.

sentences.english: By 2020, he hopes to have opened a branch overseas.

sentences.english: A chain of grocery stores currently receives its stock on a decentralized basis.

sentences.english: The next will open in Leeds next month.

sentences.english: Lan Kwai Fong are now living in Yulin Square branch of the establishment.
